headline.main: A CITY SKETCH.; Sunday Evening Amusements in New-York A Sacred Concert at the Volks' Garten.

docs.snippet: THAT LETTER AGAIN.  The Covode Committee met again this morning, but did nothing.  Mr. WINSLOW will submit to the House a protest against the manner in which the Committee possessed itself of the President's letter to Gov. WALKER.

docs.lead_paragraph: THAT LETTER AGAIN. The Covode Committee met again this morning, but did nothing. Mr. WINSLOW will submit to the House a protest against the manner in which the Committee possessed itself of the President's letter to Gov. WALKER.

docs.snippet: The Democratic members of our State Legislature have issued an address to their constituents. It is prolix on the question of the Finances and the Canal Enlargement, and eloquent upon the subject of Negro suffrage.

docs.snippet: The Conference was opened at the usual hour yesterday morning with singing, reading the scriptures and prayer by Rev. B.F. ADAMS. Further ballots for the election of delegates to the General Conference resulted in the choice of Rev. PAUL. R. BROWN...

headline.main: THE RELIGIOUS WORLD.; NEW-YORK CONFERENCE. CLOSE OF THE SESSION CHOICE OF ADDITIONAL DELEGATES TO THE GENERAL CONFERENCE CLOSING CHARGE OF THE BISHOP APPOINTMENTS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Conference was opened at the usual hour yesterday morning with singing, reading the scriptures and prayer by Rev. B.F. ADAMS. Further ballots for the election of delegates to the General Conference resulted in the choice of Rev. PAUL. R. BROWN and Rev. J.B. BEACH, (Progressive.) An election for two alternates resulted in the choice of Rev. L.M. VINCENT and Rev. L.H. KING.
